page.title: 04FINGHALL
page.content:
{Finghall}is built on a ridge of high ground to the south-east of Constable Burton and is situated on a minor road,leading from the main A684 at{ {Akebar Crossroads}up a steep hill known as Finghall Bank.The road then winds on towards Middleham.
The{church,}dedicated to St.Andrew, is at the bottom of the steep bank by the side of the beck.It is said that the original village was also by the church,but after some illness the villagers moved their houses to the higher ground.
Halfway up the bank is{Finghall Lane {Station}which is no longer in public use although the railway itself is still in use for the transportation of freight.
